alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 4:15AM PST until March 01 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 inches or less below 4500 feet and 12 to 18 inches above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall and strongest winds are expected on Wednesday. The snow level will rise to around 5000 feet Wednesday morning, then fall to around 2000 feet Wednesday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
